relation: Serum-free and Feeder-free expansion of hESCs and hiPSCs
Xenofree and Feeder-free expansion of hESCs and hiPSCs
pageTitle: KnockOut™ SR Growth Factor Cocktail | Life Technologies
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {9649=© 2015 Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. All Rights Reserved.}
textBeforeTable: Free expansion of ESCs and iPSCs in serum-free and xeno-free culture system Components required for Feeder BG01V cells were cultured under feeder-free conditions, using KnockOut™ SR XenoFree directly with KnockOut™ SR GF Cocktail on CELLstart™ Matrix in Knockout™ DMEM. At passage 15, BG01V cells were cryopreserved in the same medium and placed in liquid nitrogen storage. Photos show attachment and growth of BG01V when cryopreserved cells were recovered in feeder-free KnockOut™ SR XenoFree Medium, from day 1 (A) through day 3 (B) post thaw. Figure 3. Morphology of hESCs in a feeder-free culture. Immunostaining of iPSCs  for the expression of pluripotent marker OCT4 cultured on KSR medium with KnockOut™ SR GF Cocktail. Green color indicates Oct4 expression;  blue color represents DAPI nuclear staining of the same field. Figure 2. Pluripotent marker expression of iPSCs. (A) iPSCs were grown in KSR complete medium with KnockOut™ SR Growth Factor Cocktail on Geltrex™-coated dishes; cells exhibited morphology similar to hESCs, characterized by large nuclei and scant cytoplasm. (B) iPSCs were grown in KSR XF complete medium with KnockOut™ SR Growth Factor Cocktail on Geltrex™-coated dishes; cells exhibited morphology similar to hESCs, characterized by large nuclei and scant cytoplasm.
